H0.text: A change of state is demonstrated when a student drops a white tablet into a glass of water producing carbon dioxide gas.

H1.text: A chemical reaction is demonstrated when a student drops a white tablet into a glass of water, producing carbon dioxide gas.

H2.text: The creation of matter is demonstrated when a student drops a white tablet into a glass of water, producing carbon dioxide gas.

H3.text: The movement of electricity is demonstrated when a student drops a white tablet into a glass of water, producing carbon dioxide gas.

A4.text: Some chemical reactions have characteristics such as: Evolution of a gas Formation of a precipitate Change in temperature Change in state

A5.text: Chemical reactions are usually characterized by a chemical change, and they yield one or more products, which usually have properties different from the reactants.

A6.text: The sodium bicarbonate and acid salts react to produce gaseous carbon dioxide.
